gov.nih.nlm.ling.brat

Class StandoffAnnotationReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.brat.StandoffAnnotationReader

  • public class StandoffAnnotationReader
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to read a text file and its corresponding standoff annotation files.

    It currently handles the type of objects brat annotation tool can create. These include terms (or named entities), relations (such as coreference), events (or predicate-argument structures), event modifications (speculation, etc.), and references (concept information).

    It can read multiple standoff annotation files associated with a single text file.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

      • readTextFile

        public static Document readTextFile(java.lang.String id,
                                    java.lang.String txtFileName)
        Creates a Document object from a the text file associated with the standoff annotations.
        Parameters:
        id - the id to give to the Document object being created
        txtFileName - the name of the text file
        Returns:
        a Document object representing the content of the text file, or null if the file cannot be read

      • readAnnotationFiles

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> readAnnotationFiles(java.util.List<java.lang.String> annFileNames,
                                                                                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> parseTypes)
        Reads a list of standoff annotation files, only considering the semantic types provided with parseTypes variable.

        It returns a Map object, where the keys are annotation types used by brat (Term, Equiv, Event, Relation, Modification, Reference) and the values are the lines with the corresponding annotation type. This method does not perform actual instantiation of semantic objects. It currently ignores N* lines (notes). If parseTypes is null, it will try to load all semantic types.

        Parameters:
        annFileNames - the list of standoff annotation files
        parseTypes - the list of semantic types to parse
        Returns:
        a Map of semantic class/lines key-value pairs.

      • parseAnnotations

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Class,java.util.List<Annotation>> parseAnnotations(java.lang.String docId,
                                                                                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> lines,
                                                                                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> ignoreArgTypes)
        Parses annotation objects from their string representation. The output is a Map object, where the keys are class objects for annotation types and the values are lists of objects belonging to that class.

        This method currently handles Term, Relation, Event, Modification, and Reference annotations.

        Parameters:
        docId - the document identifier
        lines - a Map of lines, returned by #readAnnotationFiles(List, List).
        ignoreArgTypes - the argument types to ignore, if any, for non-atomic semantic objects
        Returns:
        the Map object of annotation class/annotation objects pairs

        protected static TermAnnotation readTermLine(java.lang.String docId,
                                             java.lang.String line)
        Instantiates a TermAnnotation from a standoff annotation string.
        Parameters:
        docId - the document id
        line - the line corresponding to the term annotation
        Returns:
        a TermAnnotation object

        protected static RelationAnnotation readRelationLine(java.lang.String docId,
                                                     java.lang.String line,

        Creates a RelationAnnotation instance from the corresponding standoff annotation string.
        Parameters:

        line - the relation annotation line
        ignoreArgTypes - argument types to ignore
        Returns:
        a RelationAnnotation object, or null if there are unresolved or invalid arguments

        protected static PredicationAnnotation readPredicationLine(java.lang.String docId,
                                                           java.lang.String line,

        Creates a PredicationAnnotation instance from the corresponding standoff annotation string.

      • readModificationLine

        protected static EventModificationAnnotation readModificationLine(java.lang.String docId,
                                                                  java.lang.String line,
                                                                  java.util.List<java.lang.String> ignoreArgTypes)
        Instantiates a EventModificationAnnotation from a standoff annotation string.

        It currently expects [ID]tab[MOD_TYPE] [EVENT_ID] [VALUE] format, where VALUE is optional.

        Parameters:
        docId - the document id
        line - the line corresponding to the modification annotation
        ignoreArgTypes - argument types to ignore if any
        Returns:
        a EventModificationAnnotation object, or null for a line with unexpected format

      • readReferenceLine

        protected static void readReferenceLine(java.lang.String docId,
                                        java.lang.String line)
        Adds normalization information from a standoff annotation to the corresponding TermAnnotation object.

        Currently, it assumes the source for normalization information is UMLS.

        Parameters:
        docId - the document id
        line - the line corresponding to the reference annotation
